summary: Two transitive dependency vulnerabilities were detected in the TypeScript SDK test coverage package: @babel/traverse (CVE-2023-45133, CVSS 8.8) allowing arbitrary code execution during compilation, and semver (CVE-2022-25883, CVSS 7.5) vulnerable to ReDoS attacks. The issue was automatically closed as the vulnerable libraries were no longer part of the inventory.
userImpact: Users could be exposed to arbitrary code execution during compilation when using affected Babel plugins or to denial-of-service attacks if untrusted semver ranges are processed.
rootCause: Outdated versions of transitive dependencies @babel/traverse-7.21.4 and semver-7.5.0 containing known security vulnerabilities in the dependency chain.
proposedFix: Upgrade @babel/traverse to 7.23.2 or later and semver to 7.5.2 or later, or update dependent packages to their latest versions.
resolutionDetails: Automatically closed by Mend as the vulnerable library was no longer part of the inventory or was marked as ignored in the specific branch.
keyQuote: The vulnerability has been fixed in @babel/traverse@7.23.2 and @babel/traverse@8.0.0-alpha.4.
